page.title: 05Ecology of Charnwood
page.content: Due to its altitude the climate here is slightly cooler than Leicestershire generally,fresh breeze in summer and heavier snow falls in winter.Homes in Whitcrofts Lane are occasionally cut off.Beacon Hill is particularly exposed to east winds and visitors comment there is no higher land as far as Siberia.The area is very accessible on foot.In addition to some 150 acres of public open space there are over 5 miles of public footpaths across fields and covering almost the whole area.Stiles are either wooden with a diagonal step or a narrow gap in stone walls.In a very beautiful area it is much regretted that litter especially of household and garden rubbish is often dumped in hedgerows along the roads from passing cars.Also stones from the walls and leafmould from the woods find their way into city gardens
